Message.Title: Will something happen today?
Message.Msg: As of now, the stock is not showing any signs of tradable moves one way or another. I have to wait for the next call buying opportunity. I may not get any today.

Q. Cody, why do you think some stocks like AMZN and FIO trade at such large PE ratios, while other companies with similar growth don’t, like AAPL? A. Amazon’s P/E is vastly inflated because the company is so focused on investing in their infrastructure to fuel future growth. Bezos could and will some day turn on the earnings spigot and lay off the spending and earnings growth will blow away most analysts’ minds and models. Amazon is trading at “only” 1.3x sales, while Apple, as previously noted, is trading at 3x sales. And in FIO’s case, it’s that the market rightly sees that there’s a potential that this company could grow sales 5-fold over the next five years and that would make earnings power huge in five years. Q. Cody based on your Amazon Price to Sales, is the bullish case that Amazon could triple from these price levels over the next 5 years as the earnings improve? A. Yes, well said.

Sure, it's cheap compared to some others we know: but as the biggest market cap company that counts on putting out new versions of stuff, it gets more risky as it goes higher, and the bar comparisons to earlier sucessful realease qtrs gets tougher. Plus the carriers are getting more strict with unlimited data plans without paying for them. We'll see. Certainly continues to be a parabolic rock star.
